Line 24: Line 24:
==Modelling career (1966-1970)==
==Modelling career (1966-1970)==
  +
[[File:Twiggy promo.jpg|thumb|Twiggy in 1967, at the height of her modelling career, showing the look which made her famous.]]
Twiggy is best remembered as one of the first international supermodels and a fashion icon of the 1960s and 70s.<ref name="face66">{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/breakfast/4725427.stm |title=The face of '66 |publisher=BBC News |date=2005-07-29 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> Her greatest influence is [[Jean Shrimpton]],<ref>{{cite web|author=AAP |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/life-style/138961 |title=60s icon Twiggy offers fashion advice |publisher=Stuff.co.nz |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref><ref name=dickinson>{{cite web|url=http://channels.isp.netscape.com/celebrity/hollywoodexclusive.jsp?feature=ce_hol_09212005 |title=Dickinson 1st Supermodel? Not! Says Twiggy |publisher=Channels.isp.netscape.com |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> whom Twiggy considers to be the world's first supermodel.<ref name=dickinson /> Twiggy has also been described as the successor to Jean Shrimpton.<ref>{{cite journal|title=TV: Camera on Twiggy; Cinema Verite Technique Helps Exploit Visit of Model Most in Vogue|url=http://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0E16F63C5C107B93CAAB178FD85F438685F9|work=The New York Times|author=Gould, Jack|date=1967-04-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|title=The Arrival of Twiggy|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=b1YEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA33&dq=successor+twiggy+shrimpton&lr=&as_drrb_is=q&as_minm_is=0&as_miny_is=&as_maxm_is=0&as_maxy_is=&as_brr=0&cd=1#v=onepage&q|work=Life|date=1967-02-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|title=Pin Thin, Leggy Twiggy Is Tops|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1499&dat=19661124&id=sOAjAAAAIBAJ&sjid=2CcEAAAAIBAJ&pg=7231,1716337|date=1966-11-24|work=Milwaukee Journal}}</ref><ref name=hbtwig>[http://www.harpersbazaar.com/fashion/fashion-articles/famous-models-0409 Best Models of All Time: #7 Twiggy] ''Harper's Bazaar''.</ref> In January 1966, young Lesley Hornby had her hair colored and cut short in Mayfair at The House of Leonard,<ref>{{cite web|author=sentimentalsusan |url=http://modsixties.5forum.net/susan-camp-editors-updates-f9/twiggy-leonard-of-london-hairdo-magazine-1967-t544.htm |title=Twiggy & Leonard of London ~ HairDo Magazine 1967 |publisher=Modsixties.5forum.net |date=2008-11-10 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> owned by celebrity hairdresser Leonard.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.twiggylawson.co.uk/fashion.html |title=Twiggy - The Official Site |publisher=Twiggylawson.co.uk |date=1966-02-23 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> The hair stylist was looking for models on whom to try out his new crop haircut and he styled her hair in preparation for a few test head shots.<ref name="twiggy60">{{cite web|author=Jess Cartner-Morley |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2009/sep/19/twiggy-at-60-interview |title=Twiggy at 60: 'It's amazing I didn't go bonkers' |publisher=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> A professional photographer Barry Lategan took several photos for Leonard, which the hairdresser hung in his salon. Deidre McSharry, a fashion journalist from the ''[[Daily Express]]'', saw the images and asked to meet the young girl.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.fidmmuseum.org/museum/2009/11/twiggy-.html |title=Twiggy |publisher=FIDM Museum Blog|date=2009-11-02 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> McSharry arranged to have more photos taken. A few weeks later the publication featured an article and images of Hornby, declaring her âThe Face of â66.â<ref name="face66" /><ref name="portraitgallery">{{cite web|author=Maev Kennedy |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2009/jul/08/twiggy-exhibition-national-portrait-gallery |title=Face of 2009: Gallery celebrates Twiggy's career |publisher=Guardian |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> In it, the copy read: "The Cockney Kid with a face to launch a thousand shapes ... and she's only 16! - ''The Daily Express'', 23 February 1966.
Twiggy is best remembered as one of the first international supermodels and a fashion icon of the 1960s and 70s.<ref name="face66">{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/breakfast/4725427.stm |title=The face of '66 |publisher=BBC News |date=2005-07-29 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> Her greatest influence is [[Jean Shrimpton]],<ref>{{cite web|author=AAP |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/life-style/138961 |title=60s icon Twiggy offers fashion advice |publisher=Stuff.co.nz |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref><ref name=dickinson>{{cite web|url=http://channels.isp.netscape.com/celebrity/hollywoodexclusive.jsp?feature=ce_hol_09212005 |title=Dickinson 1st Supermodel? Not! Says Twiggy |publisher=Channels.isp.netscape.com |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> whom Twiggy considers to be the world's first supermodel.<ref name=dickinson /> Twiggy has also been described as the successor to Jean Shrimpton.<ref>{{cite journal|title=TV: Camera on Twiggy; Cinema Verite Technique Helps Exploit Visit of Model Most in Vogue|url=http://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0E16F63C5C107B93CAAB178FD85F438685F9|work=The New York Times|author=Gould, Jack|date=1967-04-28}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|title=The Arrival of Twiggy|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=b1YEAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA33&dq=successor+twiggy+shrimpton&lr=&as_drrb_is=q&as_minm_is=0&as_miny_is=&as_maxm_is=0&as_maxy_is=&as_brr=0&cd=1#v=onepage&q|work=Life|date=1967-02-03}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal|title=Pin Thin, Leggy Twiggy Is Tops|url=http://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1499&dat=19661124&id=sOAjAAAAIBAJ&sjid=2CcEAAAAIBAJ&pg=7231,1716337|date=1966-11-24|work=Milwaukee Journal}}</ref><ref name=hbtwig>[http://www.harpersbazaar.com/fashion/fashion-articles/famous-models-0409 Best Models of All Time: #7 Twiggy] ''Harper's Bazaar''.</ref> In January 1966, young Lesley Hornby had her hair colored and cut short in Mayfair at The House of Leonard,<ref>{{cite web|author=sentimentalsusan |url=http://modsixties.5forum.net/susan-camp-editors-updates-f9/twiggy-leonard-of-london-hairdo-magazine-1967-t544.htm |title=Twiggy & Leonard of London ~ HairDo Magazine 1967 |publisher=Modsixties.5forum.net |date=2008-11-10 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> owned by celebrity hairdresser Leonard.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.twiggylawson.co.uk/fashion.html |title=Twiggy - The Official Site |publisher=Twiggylawson.co.uk |date=1966-02-23 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> The hair stylist was looking for models on whom to try out his new crop haircut and he styled her hair in preparation for a few test head shots.<ref name="twiggy60">{{cite web|author=Jess Cartner-Morley |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2009/sep/19/twiggy-at-60-interview |title=Twiggy at 60: 'It's amazing I didn't go bonkers' |publisher=The Guardian |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> A professional photographer Barry Lategan took several photos for Leonard, which the hairdresser hung in his salon. Deidre McSharry, a fashion journalist from the ''[[Daily Express]]'', saw the images and asked to meet the young girl.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blog.fidmmuseum.org/museum/2009/11/twiggy-.html |title=Twiggy |publisher=FIDM Museum Blog|date=2009-11-02 |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> McSharry arranged to have more photos taken. A few weeks later the publication featured an article and images of Hornby, declaring her âThe Face of â66.â<ref name="face66" /><ref name="portraitgallery">{{cite web|author=Maev Kennedy |url=http://www.guardian.co.uk/lifeandstyle/2009/jul/08/twiggy-exhibition-national-portrait-gallery |title=Face of 2009: Gallery celebrates Twiggy's career |publisher=Guardian |date= |accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> In it, the copy read: "The Cockney Kid with a face to launch a thousand shapes ... and she's only 16! - ''The Daily Express'', 23 February 1966.
